column5: Well our family went to my friends cottage near the bancroft area for the bass opener,so we started early sat morn,and hit a few of our fav spots,because it was so cold,dang 7 degrees out,we were tossing jigs & small cranks,and a beetle spin,into the numerous logs and fallen trees in the lake to get to the bass,and well it worked and we did well,we didnt catch any real big bass,but lots in the 2lb range,and of course lots of small bass as well and the ocasional rock bass,my bud almost caught a lake trout when he was using a leech tossing it along a steep rock wall,the trout came almost right to the boat before he turned away,and we both seen a splash and watched him swim away in the crystal clear water....and we just repeated the same tactics on sunday,and we figure we landed about 30 or so bass mostly largemouth with maybe 10 smallies,like i said all in the 1-2lb range,they were eager and scrappy,so it kept us busy. the majority of our bass came from casting to structure,and man this lake has stumps,fallen trees,huge boulders,shallow weed flats as well as structure near deep drop offs,so there is so much to fish its amazing..i also had time to spend with my little daughter,who just loves fishing,and her and i went fishing and had a great boat ride all around the lake,she caught lots of rock bass and sunfish,she just loved it...i think i am going to have a fishing companion for life,all she wanted to do all weekend is fish with me she couldnt get enough...so here is some pics of everything,from my buds place....so enjoy.....i was hoping that the lakair trip wasnt on the bass opener so we could have come,but for about 15yrs i have always had the bass opener at my friends place so maybe next year,
Thanks fd, that's a beautiful bunch of pictures !!
Nice report! That water has top water written all over it. Too bad there was a cold front.

Great report bud, beauty spot and it looks like your daughter had a blast! Very inspiring 'cause mines about the same age and I'm hoping she has the same enthusiasm when I bring her north in a couple weeks....  cheers

Yes we did have a great relaxing weekend and we will have alot more    Geez I thought Angelina would NEVER come off that dock. As soon as she woke up and right after her meals and right up until bedtime, she was fishing! I think we should call her FishergirlJR.
Great report and great pictures.  Wish I could get up early to experience those kind of mornings on a lake! LOL
Nice pics there Shawn.Nothing like an early mornig on the water.Dan
awesome shawn! you mustve had a blast!
Nice to see you all having a great weekend away togeather.....Love the photo's and great report shawn
Nice report bud and nice shirt.LOL   TFS
Great report and pictures Shawn! Thanks for sharing.  ps. Ko-Man-Chi is Japanese for "Clothiers to the world".
Great report and pics Shawn!  Looks like everyone had a great time out there.  The pics of your little one are priceless!!

Nice fish. The best part of the day is early in the morn when the steam is rising off the lake into the morning sun, and you got some gret pics of that.  Thanks for the pics and great work on the fish.
great report and nice fish man .....looks like a beauty spot
